req.name: profile
req.description: Profile object to create

_id.description: Unique identifier generated by the database (ObjectId as string)

logo.description: URL or identifier for the logo

userId.description: Identifier of the user who owns this profile

createdAt.description: ISO timestamp when the profile was created

404.description: Profile already exists (controller uses 404 in this case)

409.description: Conflict or other error occurred while creating the profile

req.name: searchQuery
req.description: User identifier used to find a profile by its userId (mapped to req.query.searchQuery).

req.name: body
req.description: User signup payload

200.description: Successful signup. Returns created user (result), an associated userProfile (if any), and an authentication token.

_id.description: MongoDB generated identifier for the user

expireToken.description: Expiry date/time of the reset token (if set)

userProfile.description: Profile document associated with the user, if any. May be absent/null in some cases.

userId.description: Array of user id strings as stored in the profile

token.description: JWT token issued for the newly created user

400.description: Bad Request — either the user already exists or the provided passwords do not match.

message.description: Human-readable error message, e.g. 'User already exist' or 'Password don't match'

500.description: Internal Server Error — an unexpected error occurred while processing the request.

message.description: Generic error message, e.g. 'Something went wrong'

req.name: body
req.description: Request body containing the email address for password reset

200.description: Password reset request processed successfully; an email has been sent if the account exists.

422.description: User with the provided email does not exist in the database.

error.example: User does not exist in our database

req.name: resetRequest
req.description: Payload containing the new password and the reset token sent to the user's email

password.description: The new password to set for the user

token.description: The password reset token previously emailed to the user
